comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/4.0b12pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/4.0b12pre

Minefield does not render the above page correctly.  Refer to the Internet Explorer screenshot to see what the page is supposed to look like.  There are extra links on the top of the page, which are actually supposed to be listed under the menu headings (About, Markets, Products and Services).

Reproducible: Always
comments.creator: cab26715@live.com
comments.author: cab26715@live.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/4.0b12pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/4.0b12pre

Minefield does not render the above page correctly.  Refer to the Internet Explorer screenshot to see what the page is supposed to look like.  There are extra links on the top of the page, which are actually supposed to be listed under the menu headings (About, Markets, Products and Services).

Reproducible: Always

I see the same (incorrect) rendering in Chrome 9.0.597.98.

This page uses document.layers and <layer>, both of which are non-standard and I believe not supported (document.layers is undefined in Gecko).

The owner of this page should also ensure the markup validates: http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.pacopumps.com%2Fhomepages%2FPacoHome.asp&charset=%28detect+automatically%29&doctype=Inline&group=0

I would say this is an issue with the page markup and JS not being cross-browser compatible.
